titlepage.titleproper: Guide to the Duke University Progress Pictures Collection, 1925-1932
titlepage.publisher:
University Archives
Duke University
Durham, North Carolina 27708-0185 USA

did.head: Descriptive Summary
did.physloc: For current information on the location of these materials, please consult the Library's online catalog.
did.abstract: These photographs were taken during the initial construction of Duke University, 1925-1932.

There is one set of pictures for East Campus and two sets for West, and modern copy prints and copy negatives of some images. The collection includes approximately 1000 mounted images in two bound sets (copy 1 and copy 2), along several file folders of mounted and unmounted prints.

accessrestrict.head: Access Restrictions
accessrestrict.p: Researchers must register and agree to copyright and privacy laws before using this collection.

userestrict.head: Copyright Notice
userestrict.p: Copyright for Official University records is held by Duke University; all other copyright is retained by the authors of items in these papers, or their descendants, as stipulated by United States copyright law.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: [Identification of item], Duke University Progress Pictures Collection, Duke University Archives, David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library, Duke University.

acqinfo.head: Provenance
acqinfo.p: The Duke University Progress Pictures Collection were received by the University Archives as a transfer in 1975 and a gift in 1993.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: Accession is described in this finding aid.
Descriptive sources and standards used to create this inventory: DACS, EAD, NCEAD guidelines, and our local Style Guide.
This finding aid is NCEAD compliant.

bioghist.p: These photographs were taken during the initial construction of Duke University, 1925-1932. According to the specification books for individual buildings, the contractor was to "furnish to the Architect each month during the construction of the structure, three photographs in duplicate, showing the progress of the work during the preceding month, taken from three different points to be agreed upon and always from the same points. These photographs shall be 8 x 10 inch, mounted on linen, with a hinge on the left hand margin of the photograph."

The Duke Construction Company was formed in 1927 on the advisement of the Building Committee of the Duke Endowment. In a letter to Duke president R.L. Flowers, N.A. Cocke, Assistant Secretary of the Duke Endowment, wrote:

"It is hardly practicable to conduct the operations in the name of the trustees of The Duke Endowment for the reason that The Duke Endowment has no separate entity apart from the trustees, it not being a corporation. On the other hand while the title to the property is in Duke University the Will and Trust Indenture contemplate that the trustees shall erect the buildings for Duke University and turn same over when completed. With the idea, therefore, of establishing some medium for the purpose of carrying on this construction, it has occured to us that it would be wise to form a corporation, known as the "Duke Construction Company" for the sole purpose of constructing these buildings, with a nominal capital stock so that it will clearly appear that this corporation is merely an agency for carrying out this work."
The Duke Construction Company was active in the 1930s and into the 1940s, but it then became dormant and was officially dissolved in 1957.

scopecontent.p: There is one set of pictures for East Campus and two sets for West, and modern copy prints and copy negatives of some images. One set of the West Campus images (#2) is not accessioned. The other (#1) was received from the estate of W.F. Lee, likely a son of Arthur C. Lee who was the chief engineer for the construction. It is the more complete set (A93-73: five volumes + 25 unbound prints).

Most of the prints are numbered and dated on the front in white ink, and many for West Campus have a number, date, and description of the verso. Some of the prints were made into glass slides; these slides are in the Frank Clyde Brown Papers.
The collection includes approximately 1000 mounted images in two bound sets (copy 1 and copy 2), along several file folders of mounted and unmounted prints. The images range in date from 1925-1932.

The work of at least three photographers is represented in the Progress Pictures. For the East Campus photos, there are prints having the same base number with an A or B suffix, but which were taken on different dates. Some are marked on the verso "from Ramsey Studio, Durham, N.C." and others "Whitney's Camera Craft Shop, 106 1/2 E. Main St., Durham". The "A" and "B" designations are not consistent, and we cannot say that Ramsey was photographer "A and Whitney "B". Ramsey’s work predominates in the early photographs and Whitney’s in the later. Whitney's work is also represented in the West Campus pictures.

Also in the West Campus mounted prints are pictures marked "C.W. Richardson, Photographer, Duke University" or "Richardson's Photo Service…" According to the Bulletin of Duke University, volume 24, no.7a "The first twenty years" a C.W. Richardson was a member of the staff of the medical art and illustration division, which was started in 1933 (p. 44) and which included photographers. There are also unmounted numbered and unnumbered prints taken by Richardson. Some of these prints are marked News Service or Alumni Affairs. Some mounted West Campus prints are not credited, or if they were stamped by the photographer, the stamp has been covered by the mounting linen. Among the unmounted numbered and unnumbered prints, some are stamped News Service or Alumni Affairs.
The Progress Pictures are offered in jpeg format but are also available as high resolution .tif files.

controlaccess.head: Subject Headings
controlaccess.p: These are searchable subject entries for this collection. Performing a search on these subjects in the Duke University Libraries online catalog will bring up other related research materials.

archref.repository: Duke University Archives/Rare Book Manuscript, Special Collections Library

Picture taken from near Union Building, looking along front of Dormitories. This shows the concrete foundation fninished up to grade of main Quadrangle.
Picture taken from near service entrance, looking towards main entrance of Hospital, which entrance is located where mixer now stands. This shows concrete wall around sub-basement.

Picture taken from near entrance of Group "C" Dormitory looking towards Union Building. This shows the front wall of Group "C" dormitory built up to Quadrangle grade, also forms built for concrete foundation of Union Building. A large pile of stone is located between Union Building and Library.
Taken from Quadrangle in front of Chapel, looking across Union Building, with Group "C" Dormitory in the background. This shows mixing plant and forms for Union Building.
Taken from near the center of Medical School, looking across the hospital. This shows part of the service tunnel under basement floor. Mixer is located at the main entrance to hospital.

Taken from service court at far end of Group "C" dormitories. This looking across Group "C" Dormitories and Union Building, and shows forms on right of picture ready for pouring first floor of Group "C" Dormitories. The location of the Hospital and Medical School is shown in the upper center of the picture.
Taken from end of Group "C" Dormitories looking across Union Building toward location for School of Religion
Showing close-up detail of the Hospital near the Service Entrance. This shows sub-basement of Hospital.
Union Buliding in foreground with Group "C" Dormitories in the background.
Group "C" Dormitories. Taken near Union Building looking across Group "C" Dormitories.
Taken from entrance to Medical School looking across Hospital
Taken from extreme rear end looking across Group "C" Dormitories Union Building, with Hospital and Medical School in background.
View showing stonework laid on rear of Group "C" Dormitories. This shows stonework at the highest approximate level with first floor.

View taken from Medical School looking across Hospital, showing all foundations placed ready for steelwork, and practically all backfilling completed around concrete. Also showing railroad track laid through the center of the Hospital.
View showing part of foundation for Hospital near Service Entrance. Extreme lower left shows sub-basement.
View taken from end of group "C" Dormitories, looking across Union Building. This shows outside walls of Union Building and foundation of basement floor level.
View taken from service court back of Group "C" Dormitories, showing first floor of Group "C" Dormitories with steel columns erected along corridors.

View taken from rear of Union Building, looking across same toward Group "C" Dormitories. This shows forms being constructed for the basement floor. The concrete shown in the center of the picture is up to the elevation of the basement floor.
View looking across the foundation for Hospital and Medical School. Shows derrick being set up for erecting steel structure.

Taken from court in front of Chapel looking across Union Building foundation. This shows Union Building concrete completed to basement floor. In the background is shown Group "C" Dormitory with window frames set to first floor.
View taken from approximate location of Group "B" Dormitory, looking toward the rear of Group "C" Dormitory, showing structural steel and stonework.
View taken from main Quadrangle at entrance of Medical School looking across Medical School and Hospital foundation.

View taken from main Quadrangle between Union Building and Group "C" Dormitory, looking across Union Building, showing concrete basement floor complete, and on right, forms being erected for first floor of the Union Building. In center of picture is shown excavation for classroom and Auditorium. In upper center is shown location for Chapel.
Taken from end of Building showing a closeup detail of Group "C" Dormitory where same connect to Union Building.
View taken from the rear of service court of Group "C" Dormitories showing stonework and steel erected.
View taken from end of Medical School looking across Hospital showing steel erected up to second floor level on the Hospital end of the Building.
View showing the front of Group "C" Dormitories adjoining the Union Building.
View looking across basement floor of Union Building showing Group "C" Dormitories in the background.
View of Hospital taken from service court showing steel erected from sub-basement floor to second floor.
View taken from end of Group "C" Dormitories looking across Union Building, showing forms being erected above basement floor.
View looking at the rear of Group "C" Dormitories showing stonework completed to third floor level.

View showing the front of Group "C" Dormitories near location of Group "B" Dormitories. This shows stonework on the front of the Building built up to the third floor level. [Dated 1928-05-31 on photo]
View showing the entrance court to Hospital, showing structural steel erected on this part of the Building to fourth floor. [Dated 1928-05-31 on back of photo]
View taken from end of Medical School looking across Medical School and Hospital, showing steel partly erected to fourth floor on Hospital end of Building. [Dated 1928-05-31 on back of photo]
View of Heating Plant showing foundations for Building coal trestle and stack. [Dated 1928-05-31 on back of photo]
View taken from front of Library looking across same, with foundation for School of Religion at right of picture. [Dated 1928-05-31 on back of photo]
Note: many pictures show both the Law and the Library Buildings

View taken from Quadrangle near the front of classroom and Auditorium, showing Union Building below first floor, with Group "C" Dormitories in upper right hand part of picture. [Dated 1928-05-31 on back of photo]
Taken from near the rear of Union Building. Showing Union Building on the left and end of Group "C" Dormitories on right. [Dated 1928-05-31 on back of photo]
View of the Quarry near Hillsborough showing method of operation.
View of the Quarry near Hillsborough showing close up view of rock face.
View of the Quarry near Hillsborough showing rock before same is loosened with dynamite.
View of the Quarry near Hillsborough showing rock being loaded on cars. Also on the right of the picture is shown waste material from Quarry.
Showing service court entrance at Hospital. All of steel has been erected to fourth floor, and roof steel completed on wing of Building.
View showing steel on Hospital part of Building erected to Fourth Floor. No steel has been set on Medical School.
Group "C" Dormitories showing entrance to court from large Quadrangle.
Showing Union Building taken from near the end of Group "C" Dormitories.
Showing foundation completed for School of Religion and forms built for concrete foundation for Library.
